content.rendered:
With State-of-the-Art Deep Learning we change the world of Human Vision – be a part of it: You sough every new paper on DL with excitement, you are eager to try new networks and watch the loss going down, like other people watch a detective series? Perfect! If you also want to be a part of a startup, that will change the world of how we see cameras today – you should apply now…

Who we are:

We are a patent pending Berlin AI start-up, angel invested by a leading automotive supplier, and ready to change various industries by pushing the boundaries of vision.
Our software builds on extending current sensor functionality by adding an artificial intelligence layer, like deep neural networks. This creates a whole new set of use cases, as millions of sensors from automotive to healthcare wait to be upgraded.

Your contribution to something big
As the 5th full-time employee, your role will be super important to the success of the startup.

  • You’ll experiment, research and develop novel machine learning and deep learning models for reconstructing sensor data
  • You’ll implement and improve existing state of the art deep learning models
  • You’ll assist in building Deep Learning infrastructure
  • You’ll have close contact with the scientific Machine Learning community, you’ll scout and assess new approaches
  • You’ll take part in technical discussions and create new ideas within the existing Deep Learning research team

What we’ll give you:

  • High responsibility and direct impact on the company’s success
  • The option to own a part of the company you’re helping to build
  • Be a member of a dedicated team with a friendly and open mindset (basically, we are just really nice people)
  • Attractive work environment in one of the most exciting and innovative cities
  • Collaborative culture that thrives on innovation and new ideas
  • Rewards and recognition for great achievements

What you’ll bring:

  • Strong programming skills in at least one general purpose programming language such as Python or C++
  • Currently/previously professionally working on solving problems with deep neural networks, preferably in the field of computer vision
  • Personal projects showing your dedication and skills, for example, published papers, starred Github repositories or Kaggle achievements
  • Knowledge of multiple deep learning frameworks, such as Caffe, TensorFlow, Theano, Torch/PyTorch
  • You can spend hours talking about the newest papers
  • English or German speaking skills

You are welcome to share your Kaggle/Github projects or papers with us.

Looking forward to chatting with you!

title.rendered: WEB DEVELOPER / FRONTEND DEVELOPER / UX EXPERT @NBT // Next Big Thing AG

content.rendered:
JOIN OUR TEAM!

Next Big Thing AG is a Berlin-based IoT company builder that offers a complete framework for the acceleration of IoT ventures. We are an operational VC, technology provider and innovation partner made up of a strong team of business architects, tech experts and experienced founders.

We provide seed funding, engineering expertise, partnerships as well as tailored guidance for our portfolio companies, launching several ventures per year together with brilliant entrepreneurial minds.

GOALS

Be responsible for the FrontEnd of our IoT Cloud applications.

Make the NBT and the ventures websites look awesome

STRUCTURE

You work in close collaboration with our tech team and our ventures

Flat hierarchies are key in the NBT tech team

YOUR TASKS

  • Actively code, debug, test and write the corresponding documentation
  • Collaborate closely with our international software development and design team
  • Work on real and awesome things – IoT meets AI! (no e-commerce or life-changing weather app)

REQUIREMENTS

Must have:

  • Excellent knowledge in JavaScript, HTML & CSS and relevant frameworks
  • Pixel perfect design sensibilities
  • Familiarity with RESTful APIs
  • Confident with being hands-on from initial wireframes, through prototyping, into building the final product
  • Responsive & Adaptive design wisdom
  • Always helps: Positive, team-oriented and get-things-done attitude
  • You have a valid EU work permit

Nice to have:

  • Experience working with Javascript frameworks (React or Angular) and CSS pre-processing frameworks (Sass or Less)
  • Experience in UX research, user testing, A/B tests, and experiments to make data-driven decisions

OUR OFFER

  • Full time permanent contract and competitive salary
  • An exciting and exclusive focus on IoT
  • Culture driven organisation:
  • Take responsibility for your projects. No micromanagement.
  • Work with great people in an international and flat environment
  • Pleasant work environement in the new factory building in Kreuzberg:
  • Healthy working hours
  • Modern, excellently equipped workplace in the heart of Berlin
  • Standing desks for everyone!
  • Own professional makerspace, fitness studio, yoga and nap room in our new office
  • Agile, cross-functional team with lots of responsibility on the team level

RECRUITMENT AGENCY

We do not work with recruitment agencies.

RELOCATION & EU WORK VISA

For this position, we cannot offer any relocation assistance.
We can only process applicants with a valid EU work permit.
Thank you for your understanding!

APPLICATION PROCEDURE:

Due to administrative reasons, we can only process applications submitted through our website. Please, use the following link to share your CV and documents:

https://nbt-jobs.personio.de/job/33845?_pc=16347#apply

content.rendered:
Next Big Thing AG is a Berlin-based IoT company builder that offers a complete framework for the acceleration of IoT ventures. We are an operational VC, technology provider and innovation partner made up of a strong team of business architects, tech experts and experienced founders.

We provide seed funding, engineering expertise, partnerships as well as tailored guidance for our portfolio companies, launching several ventures per year together with brilliant entrepreneurial minds.

JOIN OUR TEAM! @assistr

assistr is part of the NBT-Family. As an NBT portfolio company in the healthcare space, we’re developing profitable business models in the area of medicine, care, and health tech.

Our technical solutions allow for a more independent life of elderly people and people in need of care. Beyond this our products have a positive ethical and social impact, favourable brand effect and a large business potential due to an underserved and growing market. We make sure that all stakeholders benefit from our solutions.

STRUCTURE

You work in close collaboration with our founders
Flat hierarchies are key
We hire people whose trajectory will explode when they join us, pulling us along with them

YOUR TASKS

  • Work in a close and trusting relationship with our CTO
  • Play a vital part in our embedded systems development processes and architecture from the planning to the implementation and tests
  • Take an active role in decisions on designing and implementing the embedded architectures
  • Offer guidance to Junior and intermediate developers
  • Evaluate different technologies specific for the IoT world including LoRa, NB-IoT, 6LoWPAN, Z-Wave, WiFi and BLE
  • Actively code, debug, test and write the corresponding documentation

REQUIREMENTS

  • Excellent knowledge of embedded architectures
  • Strong startup spirit and love for dynamic work environemnts
  • Flexibility
  • Positive attitude
  • Ownership of your work
  • Excellent knowledge in C/C++, embedded linux and the common tool chains
  • Very good experience in debugging of embedded systems
  • Very good experience with sub GHZ wireless communication

OUR OFFER

  • Full time permanent contract and competitive salary
  • An exclusive focus on IoT in the assisted living industry
  • Day 1 responsibility and freedom for your ideas
  • Culture driven organisation:
  • Take responsibility for your projects. No micromanagement.
  • Work with great people in an international and flat environment
  • Pleasant work environement in the new factory building in Kreuzberg:
  • Healthy working hours
  • Modern, excellently equipped workplace in the heart of Berlin
  • Standing desks for everyone!
  • Own professional makerspace, fitness studio, yoga and nap room in our new office
  • Agile, cross-functional team with lots of responsibility on the team level

RECRUITMENT AGENCY

We do not work with recruitment agencies.

RELOCATION & EU WORK VISA

We offer relocation assistance for this position regarding paperwork, visa and first steps in Germany.

APPLICATION PROCEDURE:

Due to administrative reasons, we can only process applications submitted through our website. Please, use the following link to share your CV and documents:

https://nbt-jobs.personio.de/job/34316?_pc=16347#apply

Not everyone can be a full stack developer. With the constant influx of new technologies, they are fast learners. They have the courage and confidence to dive into any software layer. Front end UX code? No problem. REST API code? Bring it on.

You have to:

  • Love creating and calling REST APIs that use JSON
  • Know how to write testable code

  • React
  • Redux
  • Typescript
  • JQuery

System One is an established player in the booking agencies’ —the intermediates between event organisers and artists— market, in business since 2001.   • Work in our great office in the heart of Berlin, Mitte
  • Plenty of opportunities for professional growth.
  • A dynamic and young work environment with international co-workers and customers.
  • An ergonomic workplace with a healthy standing desk.

title.rendered: Full-Stack web engineer with passion for CSS and design \\\ (f/m) // sablono

content.rendered:
You will join a small but amazing international and agile product team that enjoys working together closely on a day-to-day basis. Our team is dealing with a broad range of tasks like creating a CI/CD infrastructure, crafting a database design or designing an appealing user interface to just name a few. Regular discussions, brainstorming and prototyping are a crucial part of our software development, which is why we are looking for someone who is passionate about discussing thoughts and ideas.

## Full-Stack web engineer with passion for CSS and design \\\ (f/m)

Sablono is a Berlin-based start-up company developing software for the AEC (Architecture, Engineering, Construction) industry. Our online progress monitoring platform enables project management in construction companies to capture, handle and analyse reliable progress information of complex building projects in real-time.

With Sablono’s web-based platform and mobile applications people in the industry can collaboratively monitor and understand the current project development and track individual components from production to installation. Wanna see it in action: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jovrhppQhXE

Together with our existing clients consisting of well-known international companies we are aiming at revolutionising the way people work in construction. For this, we are currently looking for a professional and passionate developer to join our team.

## Your role on the team

You will join a small but amazing international and agile product team that enjoys working together closely on a day-to-day basis. Our team is dealing with a broad range of tasks like creating a CI/CD infrastructure, crafting a database design or designing an appealing user interface to just name a few. Regular discussions, brainstorming and prototyping are a crucial part of our software development, which is why we are looking for someone who is passionate about discussing thoughts and ideas.

You will have the opportunity to participate in all these fields while taking the lead when it comes to develope a strong CSS architecture and shaping the design and user experience of our mobile and web applications.

## What we are looking for

  • Professional development experience
  • Strong knowledge about CSS in large applications
  • Profound experience with JavaScript, Angular/AngularJS and RESTful APIs
  • Wide ability to use object oriented methodologies and design patterns
  • Strong analytical mindset
  • Fluent in English
  • Willing to live in or move to Berlin

## Other skills that will accelerate your career at Sablono

  • Writing unit and integration tests
  • Working with and designing relational databases (SAP HANA)
  • Ability to deal with graph data structures and graph algorithms
  • Developing hybrid mobile applications with Cordova and NativeScript
  • Creating CI/CD pipelines

## What we have to offer

Our offices are located in the heart of beautiful Charlottenburg, surrounded by numerous cafes, restaurants, and shops. Our international team consists of passionate software engineers as well as highly motivated marketing and sales folks who take pride in being a crucial and important part of our joint mission. We provide state-of-the-art technology, team events and a lot more:

  • Offices in the heart of Berlin
  • Challenging tasks & widespread career-choices
  • Start-up atmosphere & a great team
  • Flexible work-hours
  • Competitive salary

__Send us your CV today!__

title.rendered: Senior Frontend Developer (f/m) – JavaScript // Meetrics GmbH

content.rendered:
We’re looking for an experienced frontend developer with a getting things done-attitude to join our team. You’ll focus on the development of our ad verification solution, which runs on billions of devices each day as well as our customer dashboard. We work in an interdisciplinary team of backend, frontend and data engineers, product managers as well as quality assurance and DevOps experts.

Meetrics is a Berlin-based company founded in 2008 by Max von Hilgers, Philipp von Hilgers, Hendrik Schumacher and Felix Badura.Since then we develop and distribute software solutions about ad attention. Our product range spreads from viewability of display, mobile and video ads to audience verification, fraud prevention and brand safety. We therefor enable companies and agencies to optimize quality and efficiency of their online ads.

Our Team of more than 70 experts in yet 7 countries constantly strives to be European market leader in campaign measurements & optimization. More than 400 happy customers, such as L’Oréal, Nivea, Spiegel, Volkswagen and Ferrero already accompany us on our rise.To reach our goals, we need to have you on board!

Your expertise will actively contribute to constantly improve our products and services. More-over you support us in becoming even better!

What you’ll do

  • Provide technical leadership in frontend development.
  • Develop, deploy and maintain new user-facing features.
  • Translate designs and wireframes into high quality code.
  • Build reusable components and front-end libraries for future use.
  • Optimize components for maximum performance.
  • Write clean and testable code and conduct code reviews.
  • Be a mentor for new team members or juniors and share knowledge within your team.

Who you are

  • University degree in a technical field, or a comparable qualification.
  • Minimum 3 years of relevant experience with frontend technologies – JavaScript, HTML, CSS.
  • Familiar in working with frameworks like React, Backbone, Ampersand, Vue.
  • Experience in working with RESTful APIs.
  • You are familiar with unit testing frameworks such as Jasmine or Karma.
  • Knowledge of version control systems – Git or SVN.
  • Familiar with continuous integration and build tools like Jenkins, Webpack or Gulp.
  • Experience with working in an agile development environment.
  • Fluent in English.

Our tech stack

  • Frontend: HTML, CSS, JavaScript (React, Backbone, Ampersand, Vue).
  • Backend: Java, Pearl (Spring Boot, JUnit).
  • Databases: MySQL, PostgreSQL, ElasticSearch.
  • Data Engineering: Scala (Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, LinkedIn’s Gobblin).

What we offer

  • A permanent contract in full or part time.
  • An office with excellent transport connections directly at Alexanderplatz.
  • A settled work environment with flat hierarchies in an international team.
  • Free drinks, fresh fruit, lunch vouchers, private package delivery, employee discounts, team events, as well as subsidies for KITA and sports courses.
  • Flexible working hours and home office for a better work-life balance.
  • Regular feedback and the opportunity to participate in trainings, conferences, meetups and language courses as part of our employee development.
  • Plenty of room for your ideas and the chance to have an impact on the company’s development.

How to apply

Upload your application documents via: https://meetrics-jobs.personio.de/job/40797. Your contact person is Nadine.

content.rendered:
We are currently seeking a JavaScript Developer who enjoys fiddling with browser quirks once in a while, but also appreciates the ease and beauty of systems that are completely under her/his control. Is it you? Great!

At Architrave, we build state of the art software for Digital Real-Estate Management. We focus on a deep understanding of workflows and organizational principles of the industry that we combine with modern trends of web development in order to provide robust, intuitive and inspiring business software. First released in April 2014, the novelty in design and speed of our web-based document management system has gained huge attention in the industry.

We are a small, fast moving team with a short release-cycle to ensure your code goes live as fast as possible. Architrave is 2nd winner of the 2017 PropTech Innovation Award!

ABOUT THE JOB:

We are currently seeking a JavaScript Developer who enjoys fiddling with browser quirks once in a while, but also appreciates the ease and beauty of systems that are completely under her/his control. Is it you? Great!

YOUR FUTURE RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Bring your expertise and knowledge into our amazing team, make it even smarter, and help us to fill the gap between beautiful User Interfaces, complex functionality and performant code
  • Make our customers as happy as possible, solving all the challenges that come with it
  • You are responsible to validate design prototypes and implementing finalised designs

ABOUT YOU:

  • Solid experience in developing with JavaScript, CSS and HTML
  • Experiences with git, marionette.js and SCSS would be ideal
  • Experience in TDD is of advantage (ideally with Robot Framework and Selenium)
  • ES2015 understanding would be helpful
  • You love maintainable code and automated tests – or you love to learn it
  • Quick learning and proactive personality
  • PHP knowledge is a plus

WHAT WE OFFER:

  • A competitive compensation, free drinks, fresh fruits and a fully equipped kitchen
  • Flexible Working hours
  • Flat hierarchies, short and open communication flows and quick decision-making processes
  • High amount of self-determination, ownership and impact
  • A working environment that values individuals and embraces knowledge sharing
  • A highly motivated and talented team that likes to prepare lunch together but also loves to play ping-pong in the backyard of the light-flooded office area

So, what are you waiting for?

We look forward to receiving your application (CV and covering letter)!

We’d also appreciate if you forward this to anyone you think might be interested. Thanks a bunch!

Being an equal opportunities employer, we at Architrave strive for a diverse, inclusive and healthy working environment. We invite all qualified candidates to apply, regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity.

The close relationship with our customers requires Agile development techniques, with constant reviews and iterative improvements of features and workflows. We are a small, fast moving team with a short release-cycle to ensure our code goes live as fast as possible. Architrave is 2nd winner of the 2017 PropTech Innovation Award!

YOUR FUTURE RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Be the sparring partner of our DevOps – SysAdmin
  • Bring your expertise and knowledge into our team, make it even smarter, and help us to improve the quality of our products by taking ownership about all operational aspects
  • Take care about security, availability and up-time for our customers and the team’s internal services and all the challenges that come with it

WHAT IT NEEDS TO BE OUR OPERATIONS ENGINEER

  • University degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or equivalent
  • You have a strong understanding of network and Linux security concepts
  • Automation is your second name and you are truly in love with reporting tools
  • No fear of office machine setup (usually windows / Mac systems)
  • Experience with Ansible/Python for DevOps or equivalent tools
  • Quick learning and proactive personality
  • A wolf that know how to work as part of a pack but also a lion that know how to manage and lead projects on his own
  • Strong and comprehensive communication skills in English

WHAT BRINGS YOU EVEN CLOSER TO BE OUR OPERATIONS ENGINEER

  • Knowledge of Xen-Project Virtualization
  • You have worked in an agile environment before and you are familiar with Scrum
  • Experience with JIRA / Confluence
  • Background in monitoring (our stack included Munin, Nagios and ELK)
  • Understanding of private cloud services like mail server, file sharing, LADP/Authentification Management, Slack, CI

Besides those facts, you are as eager to grow and learn as we are!

WHAT WE OFFER

  • A competitive compensation, free drinks and a fully equipped kitchen
  • Flexible Working hours
  • Flat hierarchies, short and open communication flows and quick decision-making processes
  • A working environment that values individuals and embraces knowledge sharing
  • A highly motivated and talented team that likes to prepare lunch together but also loves to play ping-pong in the backyard of the light-flooded office area
  • We know the above may sound pretty demanding. But even if you feel you are not quite there yet: if this is where you want to be, we would be more than happy to help you get there!

As a dynamic and growing company we offer the perfect working environment to develop yourself to the next level. At the same time, we know about the challenges to balance work and family and are happy to find ways to combine the two. And hey, this is no “human-resource”-blabla – we are serious about that.

So, what are you waiting for?

We look forward to receiving your application (CV, covering letter and a link to your GitHub repo)! We’d also appreciate if you forward this to anyone you think might be interested. Thanks a bunch!

Being an equal opportunities employer, we at Architrave strive for a diverse, inclusive and healthy working environment. We invite all qualified candidates to apply, regardless of ethnicity, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity.

content.rendered:
Are up for the challenge of designing and implementing a world class, big data architecture that supports one of the fastest growing data companies in the opinion research industry? Does the idea of  scaling an infrastructure that enables millions of people around the world share their voice excite you? Then look no more, this is the opportunity you’ve been searching for!

The journey that awaits you:

  • Within in a high performing, agile environment, we work with the most advanced technologies out there; from AWS to auto scaling, NoSQL DBs, Docker, systems orchestration and more.
  • Knowledge share and grow with a multi-skilled, international team, motivated by making a prominent dent in society, within a casual, non-hierarchical setting.
  • Your endeavors will have significant impact company-wide, as the infrastructure you design will impact operational performance at a cross-functional scale. We’re on a fast-track, and in turn, so will your career as our Senior Infrastructure Development expert.

Your challenge:

  • You are accountable for Dalia’s IT and cloud based architectures. Furthermore, you will ensure continual improvements to achieve maximum efficiency.
  • Manage monitoring/alert tools, master to master MySQL replication, backup/recovery strategy, server down strategy, and user rights policy.
  • Manage SQL and NoSQL databases in a high availability environment.

Your profile includes:

  • 3+ years of experience in building IT architectures and expertise in at least one scripting language.
  • Strong background in Linux/Unix Administration. Configuration management tools (Puppet preferred). Strong experience with SQL, MySQL, NoSQL architectures.
  • Extensive experience with Amazon Web Services environment: EC2, RDS, S3, Route 53, Beanstalk, as well as with logs management (logrotate, syslog-ng, ELK stack).
  • Ability to write and understand highly technical documentation, with a natural skill to translate complicated technical concepts into documents.

Who are we?

Founded in 2013 and headquartered in Berlin, Dalia harnesses the app economy and advanced data science to distribute millions of micro surveys worldwide to gather and analyze real time data on consumer attitudes, public opinion and market trends. Backed by some of Europe’s leading venture capital firms, Dalia has generated over a billion answers from people spread across 96 countries with the resulting data cited in over 2.000 news articles globally.

Questions? email us at hr@daliaresearch.com or call us at +49 (0) 151 1654 5204

8fit helps you build healthy habits for life with simple, made-for-you solutions that embrace your differences, your struggles and your successes – all that makes us human. We make healthy living fun and simple by providing guidance and support – including tailored workouts and meal plans – in one easy to use app.

Your Role:

  • Create solid and detailed test cases, test plans, and documentation
  • Perform smoke, regression, and exploratory testing
  • Manually test web and mobile applications
  • Identify and document bug reports in a clear and concise manner
  • Design, develop, and execute automation scripts

Requirements:

  • You have a degree in Computer Science or a related field
  • You have 2+ years of experience in mobile testing
  • You have a strong understanding of QA methodologies, processes, and tools (ideally you are ISTQB Certified)
  • You are very detail-oriented
  • You earn bonus points for:
    • Experience with mobile test automation (i.e. Appium)
    • Programming skills in Java or other OO language

Benefits:

We’ve got a lovely office in Kreuzberg, right in front of the canal. It’s quiet, bright, and well stocked with healthy snacks.

Every Friday we get together for a lunch. We endorse healthy life choices to millions of people, and we stick to them ourselves. But don’t just take my word for it. You’re welcome to drop by and meet the team.

We love Berlin, but we don’t love the cold. That’s why every year you have the option to escape for a month with the team to some tropical destination. This coming year we are all heading to Koh Lanta in Thailand!

We like to work hard, but we believe in balance. Our office hours are quite flexible, ensuring everyone has plenty of time to exercise and enjoy life.

If you’re not in Berlin currently, let us help you make the jump! We offer relocation benefits and visa assistance for non-EU citizens.

Include in your application:

What have you done before? What are you interested in? What motivates you? Please don’t send a generic cover letter. We’d rather hear your short intro in the summary section.

content.rendered:
Data stream processing is redefining what’s possible in the world of data-driven applications and services. Apache Flink is one of the systems at the forefront of this development, pushing the boundaries of what can be achieved with data stream processing.
Apache Flink currently powers some of the largest data stream processing pipelines in the world, with users such as Alibaba, Uber, ING, Netflix, and more running Flink in production. Flink is also one of the most active and fastest-growing open source projects in the Apache Software Foundation.

data Artisans was founded in 2014 by the original creators of the Apache Flink project, and we’re building the next-generation platform for real-time data applications. We are tackling some of today’s biggest challenges in big data and data streaming.

Your role:

data Artisans is currently building a new team of Technical Support Engineers in Europe. You’ll be part of a new and fast-growing team helping customers having a great experience using our products and Apache Flink.

The role will sit at the forefront of one of the most significant paradigm shifts in information processing and real-time architectures in recent history – stream processing – which sets the foundation to transform companies and industries for the on-demand services era.

You will work with engineering teams of our customers to build the best possible stream processing architecture for their use cases. This includes troubleshooting, giving guidance on how they use their Flink applications, and helping them take their first steps with our products.

And when you’re not working with our customers, there are plenty of opportunities at data Artisans to learn more about Flink, contribute to the products and open source projects, and help evangelizing Apache Flink to users around the world.

What you’ll do all day:

  • Use your experience to solve data engineering and stream processing problems for our customers and contribute fixes back to our products and/or open source community
  • Debug issues in the customer use cases and ensure that they are addressed quickly and effectively
  • Study and understand critical system components and large cluster operations
  • Participate in occasional on-calls for critical support needs in the future
  • Provide technical support via phone, web cases and our community
  • Help us build an efficient process development
  • Become an Apache Flink and stream processing expert

You will love this job if you …

… are experienced in operating large clusters (e.g. Hadoop)

… understand architecture of data processing systems on large scale production environments (e.g. Hadoop, Kafka, Flink, Spark) – or at least that’s what you would like to learn

… have some experience in customer support roles

… logical thinking is your asset and you have strong troubleshooting skills

… are good in understanding Java and/or Scala code

… love to spend the whole day talking about Big Data technologies

… have great English skills and like talking to customers

… have at least Bachelor’s level degree in Computer Science, mathematics, engineering or similar field

What we offer:

  • Competitive salary and stock options
  • Tech gear of your choice
  • Free public transportation
  • International team environment (10 nationalities so far)
  • Flexible working arrangements (home office, flexible working hours)
  • Unlimited vacation policy, so take time off when you need it
  • Spacious office space in the Kreuzberg district of Berlin
  • Snacks, coffee and beverages in the office
  • Relocation assistance if needed
  • Great team of gifted and extraordinary software engineers
  • Hackathons and weekly technical Lunch Talks to keep your head full of inspirations and ideas!

title.rendered: Senior Software Developer, Scala/ Android // Wire

content.rendered:
We are looking for a Senior Scala/Android Software Developer with an interest in encrypted communication and privacy to work on our open source app. The ideal candidate will be an experienced, reliable and proactive individual who has the desire to grow together with the Android team and to improve the process and quality of the app. In Wire’s Android app has components both in Java and Scala, with an increasing focus on Scala. The desired candidate will have knowledge of both Android and Scala development. Wire’s source code is hosted on GitHub and the development happens through public pull requests.

About us

Wire is a European start-up based in Switzerland, with a development center in Berlin, Germany. Our team includes people from a wide range of backgrounds, united by a shared passion for communication, design and technology. We are building a simple and beautiful next generation communications experience: www.wire.com

Responsibilities

  • Share ownership of the code with the entire team through code reviews, pair programming and by debating approaches and solutions
  • Contribute to the application development as a domain expert, leading by example
  • Produce easy to read, self-documenting and testable open source code
  • Be involved on cross-platform concerns, system-wide architectural decisions and product development
  • Collaborate closely with product and design teams to create innovative user interfaces and features, optimized for Android
  • Coach junior members of the team
  • Identify and communicate concerns and obstacles

Requirements

  • 4+ years of experience developing Android and/or Scala applications preferably with some experience in both domains
  • Familiarity with both object-oriented and functional programming paradigms
  • Thoughtful about quality and keen eye for testing, both at the code level (writing unit and integration tests) and at the process level (collaborating with QA specialists)
  • Ability to stay up-to-date with the Android ecosystem, to proactively propose improvements and alternatives
  • Strong problem solving abilities, and capable of collaborating with both engineers and business stakeholders
  • Great communication skills, genuine team orientation and ability to share and receive feedback

Education
BS in Computer Science or equivalent, MS preferred

Please apply here: https://wire.softgarden.io/job/1468940?l=en

title.rendered: Senior Data Engineer – Data Platform // GetYourGuide

content.rendered:
As a Senior Data Engineer you will play a key role in designing and developing our data infrastructure, architecture and processes. You will also help make the vast amount of our data accessible, reliable and efficient to query.

About GetYourGuide:

With 400 employees from 50 nationalities, GetYourGuide is on a mission to turn trips into amazing experiences, using our product and technology to change the way travelers find and book things to do and explore their destination. We connect these travelers to our vast catalog of amazing experiences through our online marketplace.

Team Mission:

The Data Platform team plays a central role in our data-driven strategy, designing and developing our data infrastructure, processes and analytics capabilities. We work on problems such as events pipelines, analytics or large-scale applied machine learning. The team is also responsible for making the vast amount of data accessible, reliable and efficient to query, so our teams can make the best data-driven decisions. We work on a modern Spark stack and our language of choice is Scala.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, build and refine our data and analytics infrastructure, scaling to terabytes of data
  • Grow our analytics capabilities with faster, more reliable data pipelines, and better tools
  • Design and develop a real-time events pipeline and work with data scientists, backend engineers and product managers to find new ways to leverage this data
  • Develop complex and efficient functions to transform raw data sources into powerful, reliable components of our data lake
  • Optimize and improve existing features or data processes for performance and stability

Requirements

  • You have 5+ years of experience as a Data Engineer
  • You have experience designing, developing and maintaining systems at scale
  • You have strong experience with Scala, Python or Java
  • You have strong experience big data technologies (e.g. Spark, Hadoop)
  • You have experience with building stream-processing systems, using solutions such as Kafka and Spark-Streaming
  • You write efficient, well-tested code with an keen eye on scalability and maintainability
  • You possess strong CS fundamentals and are familiar with agile development
  • You have an analytical mind and bake your decisions with data

Nice to have:

  • Experience with AWS and cloud technologies such as S3
  • Experience with Microservice Architecture

We Offer:

  • Work on a product that helps create memorable travel experiences
  • Smart, engaged co-workers
  • Speak English in the office with people from over 50 nationalities
  • Virtual stock options – be part of our success story
  • Quarterly Hackathons and weekly tech talks
  • Annual external training budget – be constantly learning
  • Well stocked kitchen and our famous pizza & beer Friday’s
  • GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
  • Relocation Assistance

Curious?

Do you have the skills for the job, enthusiasm about our vision and fit our culture? We are looking forward to hearing from you! For any further questions regarding this position contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

In the meantime, you can check our blog at inside.getyourguide.com to see what happens behind the scenes at GetYourGuide and check out Tech Radar at techradar.getyourguide.com for an insight into the stack we use to turn trips into amazing experiences!

content.rendered:
Thousands of students use the Zenjob App to find temporary work and finance their living. Over 400 businesses work with our students and cover both temporary and long-term labour-demand peaks through our concept.
We founded Zenjob, because we are convinced that work was created for mankind and not the other way around. Through technology we grant easier access to good wages and thus an improved living standard. The “Future of Work” is not only a huge societal challenge, but also an enormous opportunity. Through Zenjob we are going to partake in shaping this future.
Zenjob is financed by prestigious investors with a sustainable vision and is built as well as lead by an experienced team.

We are a team of over 80 diverse and crazy Zenjobbers from all over the world and are looking forward to welcome you!

For this position we are looking for a passionate Test Engineer (m/f) who is on the lookout for a new and exciting challenge, and who identifies with our Zen philosophy!

you:

  • Have experience in writing functional tests
  • Have experience with browser automation tools like Selenium or Geb
  • Are familiar with APIs and how to test them

Extra points if you:

  • Have worked with Groovy, Spock, Geb, Cucumber, or Selenium

If you join us, you’ll:

  • Work directly with development and product teams
  • Focus on strengthening our functional tests
  • Perform manual testing of our applications (web applications, mobile, and APIs) when there are no automated tests (yet!)

Why you should work with us:

  • We know what we’re doing, but there are still a lot of decisions to be made – so you’ll get to shape and build things from scratch
  • Experiment with new technologies and gain hands-on experience
  • After a productive day enjoy a beer with cool, fun people or go home to your family – we have a diverse team!
  • Grow with our international and creative developer team
  • Work with a young yet experienced team, in a super laid back office
  • Great equipment and Scuba Diving on Fridays

Sounds Good?

Use this link: www.zenjob.de/careers/test-engineer and apply now with your CV and tell us why you would like to join. Feel free to also contact us if you would simply like to know more. Please also tell us your salary expectations and availability.

content.rendered:
YEAY is on a mission to redefine what it means to buy and sell on mobile. Our video-based e-commerce platform makes shopping fun by allowing everyone to browse through entertaining videos and buy with a simple tap. Anyone with a smartphone can sell on YEAY – from musicians and teen entrepreneurs, to underground designers and big brands – and we provide the tools to help people produce, publish and promote their product videos all within the app. Founded by entrepreneur Melanie Mohr in 2016 and backed by an international team of investors, YEAY is a pioneering addition to the digital space. The app only came out of beta in January 2017, but we’re already available in 18 languages with hundreds of thousands of downloads and millions of video views, making us one of the fastest growing startups in Berlin. We’re a team of over 40 fun-loving, hard-working folks and we’re a truly international mix from more than 23 countries.

Looking for a strong node.js backend developer to help us support our quickly scaling eCommerce platform. You’ll be joining a small team of dedicated engineers that are working on a growing set of both user and company-facing products being built in an exciting new proprietary end-to-end shopping platform. You will be a key player in a growing dev team and you’ll see your work making a difference. We promise.

Your tasks:

  • Supporting our mobile client teams with robust API functionality
  • Implementation of scalable, secure, and performant data services
  • Integration of search functionality, personalization, and other end-user facing services
  • Being a part of discussions about scalable architecture with the rest of the team
  • Enjoying and taking pride in the work you do

What we expect from you:

  • Strong proficiency with server-side JavaScript (2-3 yrs)
  • Knowledge of Node.js and frameworks available for it, especially Express
  • Understanding the nature of asynchronous programming and its quirks and workarounds
  • Basic understanding of front-end technologies such as Angular, HTML, and CSS
  • User authentication and authorization between multiple systems, servers, and environments
  • Familiarity with NoSQL databases (However, a strong understanding of SQL methodology is always appreciated)
  • Understanding fundamental design principles behind a scalable application
  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools and methods like git
  • Experience with client-server API concepts like authentication, ACL scoping, and versioning is helpful
  • Experience implementing automated testing platforms and unit tests is a plus
  • Experience with AWS, Heroku, or other devOp platforms would come in handy
  • Experience with mobile client-side development in iOS or Android is a big plus
  • Experience making mistakes and learning from them is always welcomed
  • OpenAPI
  • If you have knowledge of other languages, like Java, Scala, Python or Ruby, this would be a plus but it is not a requirement.

What we offer you:

  • A young and dynamic environment
  • A place to work in the center of Kreuzberg at the wonderful Landwehr canal.
  • A chance to develop as quick as you are willing to grow.
  • An international team

Join our team and send us your application to jobs@yeay.com.

content.rendered:
YEAY is on a mission to redefine what it means to buy and sell on mobile. Our video-based e-commerce platform makes shopping fun by allowing everyone to browse through entertaining videos and buy with a simple tap. Anyone with a smartphone can sell on YEAY – from musicians and teen entrepreneurs, to underground designers and big brands – and we provide the tools to help people produce, publish and promote their product videos all within the app. Founded by entrepreneur Melanie Mohr in 2016 and backed by an international team of investors, YEAY is a pioneering addition to the digital space. The app only came out of beta in January 2017, but we’re already available in 18 languages with hundreds of thousands of downloads and millions of video views, making us one of the fastest growing startups in Berlin. We’re a team of over 40 fun-loving, hard-working folks and we’re a truly international mix from more than 23 countries.

Your tasks:

  • Develop native Android applications
  • Write performant, well-documented code and implement automated tests
  • Work as part of an agile team estimating and planning work commitments
  • Review pull requests from your team members
  • Take pride in the work you do and improve processes to make working better for everyone

What we expect from you:

  • Proven experience in developing native Java Android apps (3+ yrs)
  • Extensive experience in using best-practice frameworks like Dagger, Butterknife, Retrofit
  • Experience with MVP architectural pattern and basic software design patters is welcome
  • Understanding the basic concepts of reactive programming (rxJava/rxAndroid) would come in handy
  • Git version control system proficiency is a must
  • Experience with unit and instrumented tests, working in CI/CD environment are welcome
  • Up-to-date on the latest trends in mobile development
  • Kotlin experience is a plus

What we offer you:

  • A young and dynamic environment
  • A bright and airy office in the centre of Kreuzberg directly on the wonderful Landwehr canal
  • A chance to develop as quick as you are willing to grow
  • A lively international team

To join our team send your application to jobs@yeay.com

content.rendered:
Thousands of students use the Zenjob App to find temporary work and finance their living. Over 400 businesses work with our students and cover both temporary and long-term labour-demand peaks through our concept.
We founded Zenjob, because we are convinced that work was created for mankind and not the other way around. Through technology we grant easier access to good wages and thus an improved living standard. The “Future of Work” is not only a huge societal challenge, but also an enormous opportunity. Through Zenjob we are going to partake in shaping this future.
Zenjob is financed by prestigious investors with a sustainable vision and is built as well as lead by an experienced team.

We are a team of over 80 diverse and crazy Zenjobbers from all over the world and are looking forward to welcome you!

For this position we are looking for a passionate Mobile Product Manager (m/f) who is on the lookout for a new and exciting challenge, and who identifies with our Zen philosophy!

you:

  • have 2+ years experience in a product driven company delivering amazing mobile apps
  • love to create new product features starting from the initial idea to product specifications, hand-over to the dev team and final testing and release
  • have high attention to detail and are familiar with Wireframing, competitor analysis, benchmarking, UI/UX Design, Mobile Design (Android, iOS)
  • are comfortable with tools like Confluence, Jira
  • have a solid technical understanding and have successfully worked in an agile environment

If you join us, you’ll:

  • contribute to product strategy and prioritization
  • be responsible for detailed specifications of product features, setup of deliverables for scrum sprints, A/B Tests, Tracking and QA

Why you should work with us:

  • We know what we’re doing, but there are still a lot of decisions to be made – so you’ll get to shape and build things from scratch
  • Experiment with new technologies and gain hands-on experience
  • After a productive day enjoy a beer with cool, fun people or go home to your family – we have a diverse team!
  • Grow with our international and creative developer team
  • Work with a young yet experienced team, in a super laid back office
  • Great equipment and Scuba Diving on Fridays

Sounds Good?

Use this Link: www.zenjob.de/careers/mobile-product-manager and apply now with your CV and tell us why you would like to join. Feel free to also contact us if you would simply like to know more. Please also tell us your salary expectations and availability.

content.rendered:
YEAY is on a mission to redefine what it means to buy and sell on mobile. Our video-based e-commerce platform makes shopping fun by allowing everyone to browse through entertaining videos and buy with a simple tap. Anyone with a smartphone can sell on YEAY – from musicians and teen entrepreneurs, to underground designers and big brands – and we provide the tools to help people produce, publish and promote their product videos all within the app. Founded by entrepreneur Melanie Mohr in 2016 and backed by an international team of investors, YEAY is a pioneering addition to the digital space. The app only came out of beta in January 2017, but we’re already available in 18 languages with hundreds of thousands of downloads and millions of video views, making us one of the fastest growing startups in Berlin. We’re a team of over 40 fun-loving, hard-working folks and we’re a truly international mix from more than 23 countries.

Looking for a strong iOS developer to help us support our quickly scaling eCommerce platform. You’ll be joining a small team of dedicated engineers that are working on a growing set of both user and company-facing products being built in an exciting new proprietary end-to-end shopping platform. You will be a key player in a growing dev team and you’ll see your work making a difference. We promise.

Your tasks:

  • Supporting our mobile client teams with robust API functionality
  • Implementation of scalable, secure, and performant data services
  • Integration of search functionality, personalization, and other end-user facing services
  • Being a part of discussions about scalable architecture with the rest of the team
  • Enjoying and taking pride in the work you do

What we expect from you:

  • Strong proficiency with Swift, specifically iOS development (2-3 yrs)
  • Knowledge of connecting to a server via a RESTful API
  • Understanding iOS design patterns and architecture like MVVM or related patterns
  • Understanding the basic concepts of FRP, specifically RxSwift would be useful
  • Knowledge of payment frameworks like Stripe and Paypal or video streaming technologies would be a big plus
  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools and methods like git
  • Experience implementing automated testing platforms and unit tests would come in handy
  • Experience with tvOS is a plus
  • Experience making mistakes and learning from them is always welcomed

What we offer you:

  • A young and dynamic environment
  • A workplace in the center of Berlin near Kreuzberg’s wonderful Landwehr canal
  • A chance to develop as quick as you are willing to grow
  • An international team

Join our team and send us your application to jobs@yeay.com.

content.rendered:
Move24 – Award Winning Tech Startup is looking for (Senior) Business Intelligence Manager (f/m) with strong technical and business background to join our highly qualified team and help us shape the future of the global moving industry. The Business Intelligence department is a critical component to our growth and culture.

About Move24

From Berlin’s headquarter Move24 operates into different European markets such as Germany, Sweden and France. Move24’s vision is to build the world’s leading moving platform and to deliver high-quality products towards customer and local moving partners united in a strong and trustful brand. In order to balance supply and demand as well as ensuring service quality Move24 will create technology-enabled operations to revolutionize the moving jobs industry.

Your Responsibilities

  • Ownership and support of the data warehouse and reporting/analytics processes (e.g. ETL, Log processing)
  • You proactively design a companywide KPI framework
  • You implement and maintain data models using business intelligence tools/dashboards to allow different stakeholders to access the data directly
  • You enable other departments (Sales, Marketing, Operations, Product etc.) to translate high-level business problems into more specific questions which can then be answered by data-driven analysis and actions.
  • You present findings with a clear point of view so that insights can be used to help drive business strategy and technology projects.
  • The daily business will include the analysis and definition of KPIs, the reporting for all departments, the integration and comprehension of new and unfamiliar data sources, and ad hoc data analysis

Your Skills

  • You have a Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Physics or similar with heavy quantitative focus strongly preferred.
  • 2+ years of relevant experience in a business intelligence role, including data warehousing and business intelligence tools, techniques and technology
  • You have hands-on experience in working with Python, SQL, an ETL framework and PostgreSQL or other common database systems
  • Understanding of modern machine learning techniques regarding supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms. Familiarity with common frameworks like scikit and MLib
  • Relevant experience in data analysis using data visualization tools
  • Strong analytical skills, including the ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, communicate results and arrive at valid conclusions independently and self-confidently
  • Very good command of English required and the possession of strong written and verbal cross-functional communication skills

What We Offer

  • Be part of an innovative, international company that is passionate about disrupting the rapidly growing moving industry
  • Meaning – Our work has a direct impact on the international moving market
  • Very experienced management team, business angels and advisors
  • You work with a highly motivated and skilled team of young top performers with great team spirit
  • A very attractive compensation system that remunerates the quality of your work and your commitment as well as providing further incentives
  • Open channels of communication, transparent and quick decision-making and results
  • Work in a company where independent-thinking and personal responsibility are essential
  • Flat hierarchies and everyday opportunities to learn, grow and develop
  • Working with people from all around the globe
  • Enjoy a modern, light and spacious office loft with a big rooftop terrace in Berlin-Mitte including free drinks and fresh fruits

Join the Move24 team!

We look forward to receiving your application.

    expected
  • Diligent about version control, clean code, unit testing and continuous integration

  • Experience with PHP/Symfony and/or packaging for deployments on Debian is a plus

title.rendered: Scala Software Engineer (m/f) // ATS Advanced Telematic Systems

content.rendered:
ATS Advanced Telematic Systems is a German software company specializing in open standards-based software products for the automotive industry, with a special focus on software over-the-air updates. ATS partners with international industry alliances of leading automotive OEMs and suppliers, who benefit from ATS’s highly secure and flexible solutions. It is the first cloud-only service provider to be accepted into the German Association of the Automotive Industry (VDA), and spearheads OTA activities inside GENIVI and Automotive Grade Linux (AGL). Headquartered in Berlin, ATS operates a regional hub in Tokyo. For our office in Berlin, we are currently looking for a Scala Software Engineer (m/f).

Responsibilities:

  • Participate in full life-cycle software development
  • Develop highly scalable and reliable systems
  • Write clean, tested and well-documented code
  • Develop testing, building and release management software and processes
  • Develop and execute quality assurance software and processes
  • Contribute ideas for new features and identify areas for improvement
  • Collaborate effectively across teams

Essential skills and experience:

  • Degree in Computer Science or other numeric discipline
  • Minimum of 5 years of personal development experience
  • Experience developing in Scala with a focus on server side development or experience developing in other functional languages with willingness to learn Scala
  • Strong foundation in data structures, algorithms
  • Openness to new technologies and creative solutions
  • Excellent English communication skills; other languages like German a strong plus
  • Comfortable working within a fast-paced, high-growth start-up environment

Bonus qualities:

  • Some professional software development experience
  • Experience of distributed systems and microservice architectures
  • Experience with Docker / Mesos / Marathon
  • Experience with open source development, participation in free software projects and communities
  • Experience of Linux development, configuration and administration

Our offer:

  • Working with state-of-the-art technology – functional programming, IaaS/PaaS software deployment
  • The opportunity to shape a real, in-demand product in a huge and rapidly growing sector
  • The chance to contribute to Open Source software (https://github.com/advancedtelematic)
  • Hands-on coding experience from day one, working alongside experienced, talented engineers
  • Competitive salary package

If topics such as big data, internet of things, connected mobility and open standards excite you, please get in touch by sending your application to jobs@advancedtelematic.com. For more information please contact Katrin at +49 (0)30 959 997 5413 or visit our website www.advancedtelematic.com.

content.rendered:
Travelcircus is seeking a Frontend Developer to join the development team. We’re looking for someone who’s passionate about building robust & scalable frontend applications, which incorporate design, functionality as well as usability across devices and browsers. You’ll be an integral part of the engineering team and will work closely with others throughout our company to deliver the best possible product to our customers. Ideal candidates will have profound experience with AngularJS and using RESTful APIs in a Service Oriented Architecture. This position is full time and based in our great office in Berlin.

ABOUT US

Travelcircus (www.travelcircus.de) is a fast ­growing online booking platform giving people the ability to book premium, quality checked and unique hotels packaged with hotel services and exciting local activities at an exclusive price. Founded in 2014, in the heart of Berlin, Travelcircus already accommodated more than 140.000 travelers from 20 different countries and we continue to grow substantially.

We are looking for ambitious, forward thinking self-starters to join our aspiring and international team, who can keep up with our pace and want to make a difference as a:

Things You Will Work On:

  • Build and extend our Platform Services and Booking Systems on the frontend side
  • Collaborate closely with our design department and help to develop new product features from the first idea to the final product
  • Identify and address performance issues
  • Participate in design and code reviews
  • Implement best practices for frontend engineering
  • Improve our existing e-commerce platform codebase

YOUR PROFILE:

  • You have at least 3 years of experience as a Frontend Developer
  • You have working experience with large scale, service-oriented frontend architectures
  • You have excellent JavaScript skills and profound experience with common web frameworks and tools
  • You have extensive knowledge of browser mechanics, HTTP and caching techniques
  • You are creative and have a strong sense for good design and user experience
  • You have expert knowledge of cross-device and cross-browser development
  • You are knowledgeable about web services (REST/SOAP)
  • You are an open communicator and with very good language skills in English
  • You have experience in working in an interactive, agile environment & attending daily standups & scrum meetings

WHAT WE OFFER:

  • The opportunity to influence the development of our platform and products
  • A dynamic and international team that is always ready to go the extra mile
  • Flat hierarchies, short decision paths and the possibility to contribute own ideas
  • High level responsibility and opportunities for personal development
  • A chance to be part of a growing company, directly influencing its success & shaping it´s future
  • A modern equipped workplace in a new designer loft with retreat lounges
  • Regular team events and a wide range of sport activities, a fridge full of beer and non-alcoholic beverages

content.rendered:
Taledo is a curated recruiting platform connecting the top 10% of candidates with market leading companies in the digital ecosystem. Founded in 2015, we are serving clients ranging from DAX corporations to early-stage startups. On our mission to create the number one platform, our team continues to grow.

The ideal candidate:

  • Experience with React (and related tools such as redux) or comparable Javascript frameworks
  • Fluency with HTML5 and CSS3, knowledgeable about trends and methodologies
  • Excitement about thoroughly building a sustainable architecture
  • Degree in Computer Science and several years of relevant work experience
  • Understanding of Usability concepts and experience with Design tools
  • Strong communication skills, e.g. ability to talk about technical topics and express design decisions
  • Berlin residency or willingness to relocate

Your responsibilities:

You will have direct impact on the product and see your code deployed to production within a few days after joining. The Backend is written in Rails, backed by Postgres and ElasticSearch. It’s communicating via a json API to the Frontend, which is written in React and uses related frameworks such as redux and webpack. You will work directly with and report to the CTO.

Working at Taledo:

At Taledo you will work with a highly motivated team of smart people in a truly international atmosphere. While offering an environment that allows you to stay focused and to work professionally, we keep an open door policy and regularly provide fruits, healthy snacks, tea, coffee and yerba mate. Knowledge sharing and supporting each other is key to our success and offers great opportunities for your professional growth. Office is located in the center of Berlin – easy to get to and close to great cafés and bars.

title.rendered: Senior Backend Engineer (w/m) für die FinTech Plattform Europace // Europace AG

content.rendered:
Du bist ein erfahrener Entwickler (w/m) und suchst ein Umfeld das Du signifikant mitgestalten kannst? Wir bieten Dir ein Team in dem fachliche und technische Exzellenz der elementare Teil unserer Werte sind. Durch kontinuierliche Entwicklung unseres Produktes sind wir Marktführer in der elektronischen Baufinanzierung in Deutschland.

Europace ist die Plattform zur Vermittlung von Baufinanzierungen auf dem deutschen Finanzmarkt. Wir sind Teil des ersten deutschen Fintech Unicorns Hypoport und sind alles aber keine Bank. Hierarchien waren gestern, heute setzen wir auf Selbstverantwortung und die Motivation eines jeden einzelnen. Eine unserer Stärken ist, dass wir verschiedene neue Ansätze der Arbeitsorganisation ausprobieren. Wir sind Entdecker der Arbeitswelt von morgen, deshalb legen wir auch viel Wert auf ein professionelles Arbeitsumfeld, denn immerhin ermöglicht die Hypoport-Gruppe ein Kredit-Transaktionsvolumen von über 4 Mrd.€ pro Monat.

Wer du bist:

  • Du bist ein Senior Mitglied eines professionellen und hochqualifizierten Teams, welches ständig anstrebt die besten und smartesten Lösungen für unsere Businessanforderungen zu finden.
  • Du arbeitest Hand in Hand mit deinen Kollegen aus Produkt, Kundenservice und Vertrieb.
  • Du hast Lust darauf eine komplexe Domäne mitzugestalten.
  • Du entwirfst, implementierst, testest und wartest neue Features und Finanzproduktintegrationen auf der Europace Plattform.
  • Du verbesserst dich ständig und hilfst deinen Kollegen besser zu werden.
  • Du denkst unternehmerisch und richtest deine Entscheidungen an wirtschaftlichen Erfordernissen aus.

Was du kannst:

  • Weitgehende Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von serverseitigen Backends mit objekt-orientierten Sprachen (wir nutzen Java mit Spring und Groovy – wir glauben aber, dass du dich auch einarbeiten kannst).
  • Erfahrung im Entwickeln von skalierbaren und verteilten Services.
  • Interesse an Finanzprodukten. Wir arbeiten in einer komplexen Domäne und erwarten, dass jeder beim Lösungsdesign mitdenkt. Wie eine Baufinanzierung funktioniert bringen wir dir bei.
  • Erfahrung mit serverseitigen Backend-Technologien wie z.B.: Messaging, HTTP und REST, Webservices, Concurrency, Resilienz und Caching.
  • Klarheit und Offenheit in der Kommunikation.

Wie du arbeiten wirst:

  • Du entwickelst eine verteilte, Message basierte Plattform.
  • Continuous Delivery und eine hohe Testabdeckung hilft dir schnell und autonom zu agieren.
  • Das Entwicklungsteam trägt die DevOps Verantwortung.
  • Der Tech-Stack wird im Team entschieden.

Was wir bieten:

Innerhalb der Hypoport-Gruppe wertschätzen wir Vielfalt, daher bieten wir einen Arbeitsplatz frei von Stereotypen. Die Energie unserer Teams wächst mit der Vielfalt an Perspektiven die jeder einbringt. Zusammen bauen wir die führenden digitalen Plattformen für Finanzprodukte. Einige der Vorteile, die wir dir bieten:

  • Innovative Arbeitskultur und eine Umgebung in der du Dinge gestalten kannst wie in einem Startup allerdings mit dem Rückhalt eines etablierten Unternehmens.
  • Sehr gute Work-Life Balance mit flexiblen und familienfreundlichen Arbeitszeiten, Home-Office, 30 Tage Urlaub im Jahr sowie die Option dir 10 weitere Urlaubstage zu erkaufen.
  • 130 IT-Kollegen und Kolleginnen, die dich unterstützen und eine aktive Wissenscommunity gestalten.
  • Unsere Prinzipien nach denen wir arbeiten:
    • Wir führen gemeinsam.
    • Wir lernen und entwickeln uns bewusst weiter.
    • Wir arbeiten gemeinsam miteinander.
    • Wir organisieren uns dezentral und autonom.

Wenn du neugierig geworden bist, dann findest du mehr über unsere Kultur auf unserem PnO-Blog https://blog-pno.hypoport.de/. Wenn du mehr über unsere technischen Themen wissen willst, dann besuche doch unseren Europace-TechBlog http://tech.europace.de/.

Möchtest du mehr erfahren? Dann schick uns doch deine Bewerbung, gerne auch mit deinem GitHub-Account.

Bei Fragen wende dich an:

Nadine Lennartz, People & Organisation Partner

Tel. +49 30 420 86 -1925

Europace AG

Klosterstrasse 71, 10179 Berlin
